sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Portugal holds in-person voting today for its general election, with another minority government expected to be the outcome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Senior Tories join opposition leader Keir Starmer's calls to see Sue Gray's report in full amid fears it won't be complete.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Protests against Covid-19 restrictions take place in Vienna as authorities announce a gradual ease of measures from early February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Portugal geared up for a snap election this Sunday. The Iberian country has taken many steps to make sure everyone gets the chance to vote. This week, those who tested positive for the virus were given the chance to vote from home before the official election day. Current president Marcelo Ribeiro de Souza was among those who voted in person and hammered home the importance of making one's vote count. Vote because it is a proof of life, of vitality, of democracy. Proof that they want to express their voice and they should do it and they have a lot of choices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: One of the riches of our system is that it offers so many alternatives, so they should take advantage of them." The snap election is expected to produce another minority government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Opinion polls suggest the centre-left Socialist and their main rivals the centre-right Social Democratic party remain in a tight race.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Chega party on the right is also on course to become Portugal's third biggest party in government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A late surge by the opposition centre-right party, the PSD, has taken away the ruling Socialist Party's once comfortable lead in the polls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The snap election was called after the PSD's 2022 draft budget was rejected in October.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At midday, the turnout stood at 23.3 per cent, which according to sources is much higher than in previous years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ballots close at 8pm local time on Sunday, with exit polls expected shortly after.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Pressure on the British Prime Minister Boris Johnson over alleged lockdown parties at Downing Street is rising. Some senior Tory MPs have now joined the opposition leader Keir Starmer's call for full information from the civil servant Sue Gray's investigation into the events.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: What I want to see is Sue Gray's report in court and the investigation finished as quickly as possible because we're in this situation where the whole of government is paralysed because the police are now looking at what the Prime Minister was getting up to in Downing Street.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: After the police decided to investigate the scandal dubbed Partygate, they asked Sue Gray to make minimal reference to events they are looking at in her report.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And for some, this is casting doubts over how complete the report will be.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Some MPs are concerned that the police's investigation will water down the report itself and delay it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But the police have defended their position and insist that this is not the case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Downing Street has said it will publish the report as soon as it is received.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Protests were held across Vienna on Saturday against Covid-19 restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Police there reported up to 10,000 participants and some had to be dispersed using pepper spray. Fines were also given for resisting authorities, not wearing masks and violating COVID-19 restrictions on gatherings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On Saturday, the Austrian government also announced that restrictions will begin to ease.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: From February 5th, shops and restaurants will be allowed to open until midnight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: From the 12th, proof of vaccination or recovery will no longer be required to enter shops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And a week later, anyone not vaccinated will be allowed to enter restaurants as long as they have a negative coronavirus test.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And in Russia on Saturday, over 100,000 new COVID-19 cases were reported, one of the highest numbers since the pandemic started.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Authorities are trying to increase the vaccination rates of children aged 12 to 17.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: 50% of hospitalized children are between zero and four years old.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: These are children who are sick, with a high temperature, but luckily this temperature stops within two or three days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They are practically free of pneumonia. The highly spreadable Omicron variant accounts for the majority of new cases in Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of people protested on the streets of Pristina on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They are opposed to the government's plans to increase the price of energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They headed towards the parliament building, where scuffles broke out with police as they were stopped from entering.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Light bulbs were thrown against windows.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Kosovan government has said it is unable to keep energy supplies at the current price.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Canadian singer Joni Mitchell is following in Neil Young's footsteps in removing her music from Spotify, in protest against Joe Rogan's controversial podcast that spreads false information about the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Some 300 scientists have alerted Spotify to the dissemination of messages that damage trust in medical research and health recommendations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The border town of Avdiivka in the country's east, where the Ukrainian army has been fighting with Russian-backed separatists, has been living in the shadows of the prolonged war for nearly eight years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But, recently, fears have mounted that Russia, which amassed over 100,000 soldiers on its side of the border, may launch an attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There is a constant tension at the front line, he says. We do not feel any additional threats now since we are constantly under the threat here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We are always in full combat readiness and can fight back any enemy attack if they move in our direction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: 25-year-old senior lieutenant Serhii, who's been at the front line with the Airborne Brigade since 2018, does not believe Russia will dare to start a full-scale invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: After almost eight years of fighting, Ukraine has greatly improved its military capabilities along the 280-kilometer front line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: SERHII, Senior Lieutenant, Airborne Brigade, Ukraine We are ready for any development.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian army has been at war with the Russian aggressor since 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We are trained, we know the enemy's tactics, we have a very high motivation, we are on our land, the Ukrainian people are with us, we know that our families are waiting for us at home and that we protect ordinary Ukrainians who need peaceful life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And we will stand to the end.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Lieutenant Tatyana Zarytska, a spokesperson for the 25th Airborne Brigade, adds that Russian troops will face fierce resistance and heavy losses if they try to make a military move.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Moscow denies any plans to invade and says the troop buildup is part of the routine deployment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But the fear of Russian invasion remains real.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Our reporter Kate Baklitskaya outlines the concerns felt at the Ukrainian army's position.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: With the Russian army planning an offensive here at the front line in Avdiivka, Ukrainian forces feel that they are ready to meet any enemy at the frontline. Kate Baklitskaya from Avdiivka, Ukraine, for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: When it comes to election pledges, the new Bulgarian administration is wasting no time carrying them out. The new government is seeking to initiate judicial reform. Prime Minister Kirill Petkov said his government focus would be on creating a mechanism for investigating the Prosecutor General.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We will have a magistrate who will temporarily act as a prosecutor who can investigate the Prosecutor General.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But there is an obstacle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The ruling party does not have a majority needed to make constitutional changes and cannot replace either the Supreme Judicial Council or the Prosecutor General.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For that reason, the government will need to seek support from the opposition, the former ruling party GERB.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After Petkov met MEPs in Brussels alongside the Chief Prosecutor, Ivan Geshev. Geshev expressed concern about the way the government intends to implement the reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Bulgarian law does not provide a mechanism for controlling the prosecutor general or prosecuting them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The lack of accountability on the part of the prosecutor general is a legislative problem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: MEPs do not follow the recommendations of the Venice Commission and the Council of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to a ruling by the Constitutional Court, any prosecutor can be investigated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Constitutional law expert Natalia Kisalova explained how this judicial reform could be implemented.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: explained how this judicial reform could be implemented.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The magistrate will be randomly determined and they will be given the status of an investigator against the prosecutor general.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They will gather evidence to support the accusation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Kisilova added that the judicial reform could be implemented more easily through changes to the Judiciary Act. се поддържа в последствие обвинение. Киселова добави, че реформата на судебната реформа може да се имплементира по-много лесно вътре на изменения на Судебната реформа.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Съжалението ще даде Българиянската Судебната реформа власт да даде властта на властта на властта право да инвестицирова в човек-просекутор.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Но въпросът е, кой ще може да файли чарги против Просекутора-генерал.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: В моя мнение, трябва да бъде повече опциони за да въртим комплименти против Просекутора-генерал. Целта е да има работен механизъм, не фетичен. In my opinion, there should be more options for filling complaints against the Prosecutor General.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The goal is to have a working mechanism, not a fictitious one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For now, the Minister of Justice is expected to prepare the final legislative changes in the Judiciary Act, which the MEPs of Bulgaria will then urgently start voting on.
